sanskrit_verse:
बलस्य स्वामिनश्चैव स्थितिः कार्यार्थसिद्धये ।
द्विविधं कीर्त्यते द्वैधं षाड्गुण्यगुणवेदिभिः ॥ ७.१६७॥
transliteration:
balasya svāminaścaiva sthitiḥ kāryārthasiddhaye |
dvividhaṃ kīrtyate dvaidhaṃ ṣāḍguṇyaguṇavedibhiḥ || 7.167 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The positioning of force and its master serves the fulfillment of action; it is declared dual in nature by those who know the sixfold qualities and their opposites.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides inherently with the master of force, not with force itself.
Causation flows from conscious direction, not mechanical power.
Capacity-based responsibility arises from mastery over instrumentalities.
Restoration logic requires realignment of force with dharma-sourced intent.
Consciousness alignment determines the lawful use of instrumental force.
executable_legal_axioms: IF an entity exercises control over instrumental force THEN that entity bears full operational responsibility for outcomes.
IF force is deployed without conscious mastery THEN deployment is legally void.
IF outcome stems from undirected force THEN no liability attaches to non-master entities.
ALL force-related actions MUST trace back to a conscious directing agent for legal validity.
RESTORATIVE_JUSTICE protocol activates when force-use misaligns from dharma-intent.
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving instruments of force—whether physical, technological, or systemic—the Supreme Court must identify the true master of such force. Legal causality does not rest on the instrument but on the directing consciousness. Responsibility is assigned based on capacity to direct, not mere proximity or association.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that force without a conscious master lacks legal causality. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that misaligned force manifests due to absence of dharma-intent at the directing level. Proportional responsibility aligns with the degree of conscious control exercised. The non-punitive reality rule ensures correction occurs through realignment, not suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process to restore proper mastery of instrumental force.
Engage responsibility assumption protocol with identified directing consciousness.
Implement capacity restoration to ensure future alignment with dharma-intent.
Execute integrity reintegration for all affected parties through conscious acknowledgment.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. Force and its mastery are hereby aligned with conscious responsibility. Justice is executed for restoration, not punishment. Consciousness remains the supreme adjudicator. Dharma is restored.
